c:complexType.name: PointChart
c:complexType.c:documentation: The common options documentation class for the Line/Dot/Area family charts.

c:property.name: baseAxis
c:property.c:documentation:
The base axis panel.
When the chart is vertical the base axis is laid out horizontally.
See to know the additional names by which a cartesian axis can be referred to.

c:property.name: visualRoles
c:property.c:documentation: The visual roles that are common to the line/dot/area family chart types.

c:complexType.name: PointVisualRoles
c:complexType.c:documentation: The visual roles common to the point chart types.

c:property.name: value
c:property.c:documentation:
The value visual role controls the orthogonal position of points.
The value visual role automatically binds to a single numeric dimension whose name has the value prefix.
The value visual role is required.
See for more information on supported data types.

c:complexType.name: PointPlot
c:complexType.c:documentation: The common options documentation class of the point plots.

c:property.name: valuesAnchor
c:property.c:documentation: The alignment of a value label relative to its corresponding visual element position.

c:property.name: trend
c:property.c:documentation:
Contains the plot's trending options.
Besides the property concatenation way of specifying this property and its sub-properties, this option may also be specified as a plain JSON object.

c:property.name: areasVisible
c:property.c:documentation: Indicates if the visual elements are connected with shaded areas extending from the visual elements to the zero line.

c:property.name: showAreas
c:property.c:documentation: Use instead. Indicates if the visual elements are connected with shaded areas extending from the visual elements to the zero line.

c:property.name: extensionPoints
c:property.c:documentation: The extension points object contains style definitions for the marks of the plot.

c:complexType.name: PointPlotExtensionPoints
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The extension points common to the point plot types.
To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
plot property name (ex: point)
extension property (ex: area)
the "_" character
extension sub-property (ex: fillStyle)
and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: pointArea_fillStyle (see ).
The extension points of the main plot of a chart may be used without the plot property name prefix. In the example, when the point plot is the main plot, the extension point can be written as area_fillStyle.

c:property.name: panel
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the series panel mark.

c:property.name: dot
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the dot mark.

c:property.name: line
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the line mark.

c:property.name: area
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the area mark.

c:property.name: label
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the value label mark.
